Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED; ENGRAVED
Name: Vase
Description: Cylindrical vase with wide mouth and straight rim. Stable base. Body with almost straight walls, decorated at the top in a wine-red colour on the basis of horizontal and vertical lines forming metopae, with semicircular lines placed opposite each other in the imitation of leaves. There are also incised horizontal lines which encircle the body. Reddish-coloured paste and surface with whitish coating.
